dialogues.text: (Prosecutor BILL GARDNER) And who’s that, you?

dialogues.speaker: POTTINGER
dialogues.text: Don’t answer that! (steps closer) Where’s your lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: FELT
dialogues.text: I am a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: POTTINGER
dialogues.text: Where is your lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: FELT
dialogues.text: I don’t need one.

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER
dialogues.text: You will now. Pottinger pulls Felt out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: POTTINGER
dialogues.text: I can wallpaper my house with a list of the civil rights the FBI violated. If it were up to me you and Hoover and Bill Sullivan would rot in jail. (--)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it’s in your interests - and for some reason the Attorney General thinks it’s in the nation’s - to keep you out of it.

dialogues.speaker: FELT
dialogues.text: I was keeping you and your kids safe at night. But what you’re doing-- (points at the agents) --is a witch-hunt. (his swagger) It happened. I made it happen. Put me on the stand. I’1l take my chances with the jury.  154 120.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felt ram-rod straight in the witness chair. Alone before 23 diverse and sleepy AMERICANS of the grand jury. We're deep into Felt’s testimony.

dialogues.speaker: POTTINGER
dialogues.text: Counter-espionage expert, Nazi- hunter-- (half-facetious) You are the G-Man’s G-Man, Mr. Felt. A patriot and a hero. And we are a grateful nation. One or two jurors actually applaud. Gardner stands.

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, for the last few weeks you have heard through testimony the sounds of the bombs of the PLO and Weather Underground ringing in your ears. People died. We were a nation at war, at home and abroad. We don’t dispute that. Now we ask you to listen for the sound of the Constitution. (pauses for effect) Hear that? It doesn't make quite as much noise as a bomb, does it? It just sits there silent, like our conscience, as it's done for two hundred years. (turns to Felt) Mr. Felt, on September 8, 1972, did you instruct 143 FBI agents across the country to break into the homes of relatives of alleged members of the Weather Underground, to wiretap their phones and bug their homes?

dialogues.speaker: FELT
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER FELT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who else? (combative) Who else what?

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER
dialogues.text: Participated in giving those orders? (Felt says nothing, so--) Assistant Director Edward Miller.  121. INTERCUT MILLER leaning against a wall in the hallway. Th

dialogues.speaker: FELT
dialogues.text: I gave the order.

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER
dialogues.text: Acting Director L. Patrick Gray Iii. INTERCUT GRAY sitting in his barcalounger at home. Then--

dialogues.speaker: FELT
dialogues.text: I gave the order.

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER
dialogues.text: Charles Bates. (INTERCUT Bates at his desk at the FBI)

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're going to just take the bullet for everybody?

dialogues.speaker: FELT
dialogues.text: I gave the order. Pause. Enough. Now Pottinger is up.

dialogues.speaker: POTTINGER
dialogues.text: You mentioned you frequently briefed the Nixon White House during the case. While we're on that subject, why don’t you give us a quick snapshot of how that worked.

dialogues.speaker: FELT
dialogues.text: I was in constant contact with the White House on many matters. And then this thing happens to Felt. For the first time h curtain of impenetrability drops. His eyes lose focus. He begins to sweat. His hands clench. Slacken. Clench, and--

dialogues.speaker: FELT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In fact, I was in the Oval Office so often people used to say I had to be Deep Throat. (a hesitation-what??-then)

dialogues.speaker: POTTINGER
dialogues.text: What did you just say?  122.

dialogues.speaker: FELT
dialogues.text: I said I was with the White House - Dean and so forth - so often people thought I was the Washington Post source for Watergate. The guy they called Deep Throat. Stop. Pottinger just stares. Confused by what he’s heard. Then, because he’s not sure what else to do--

dialogues.speaker: POTTINGER
dialogues.text: (to the Grand Jury) Before we dismiss the witness, are there any question from the jury? MIDDLE-AGED JUROR raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: JUROR
dialogues.text: Well, were you?

dialogues.speaker: FELT
dialogues.text: Was I what? (and who are you to ask me a thing--)

dialogues.speaker: JUROR
dialogues.text: Were you Deep Throat? (and--) STOP. STAY ON POTTINGER. A long silence. His hands busy w notes. But Felt isn’t answering, so now Pottinger looks u FELT. Who is looking down. His face red. Moist. As-- POTTINGER leans forward now, sensing something--

dialogues.speaker: FELT
dialogues.text: (weak) No.

dialogues.speaker: WAIT
dialogues.text: (and Pottinger leaps up, points at the steno) Off the record!

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER POTTINGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell’re you doing? I’m not sure-- What he’s doing is marching straight at Felt. And we’re-- CLOSE ON FELT & POTTINGER. Faces three inches apart. A be of sweat traces down Felt’s forehead.  155 123.

dialogues.speaker: POTTINGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (low; just them) I'm going to remind you that perjury is a Class A felony. But I also consider the question that man just asked you outside the specific scope of this investigation. So if it is your wish that I have the question withdrawn, and your answer stricken from the record, I will do so. I will make it like it never happened. No one will know. Felt won’t look Pottinger in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: POTTINGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whisper now) I think I understand what’s at stake here now. Do you? A long excruciating beat. Felt’s furious at himself.

dialogues.speaker: FELT
dialogues.text: Withdraw the question.

dialogues.speaker: POTTINGER
dialogues.text: I need you to repeat that. I need to be sure. Say it again.

dialogues.speaker: FELT
dialogues.text: Withdraw the question.

dialogues.speaker: POTTINGER
dialogues.text: Jesus christ. Pottinger stares at Felt. He now knows America’s most dangerous and valuable secret. The “Antichrist” is his fucking hero. Felt is Deep Throat.

dialogues.speaker: POTTINGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the room) Other questions for this witness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen FBI AGENTS mill about the sidewalk. BOB WOODWARD standing around with a couple of REPORTERS. Limo PULLS UP. Out steps Felt. Then Miller. Gray. Audrey Pat Miller already there waiting on the sidewalk. As we h  156 157 124.

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER, (OVER)
dialogues.text: Fifteen counts of conspiracy to violate the constitutional rights of Americans... (and now cut to--) ANGIE LANO LEADING THEM THROUGH FINGERPRINTING, as-- 156 Audrey & Joan (and Pat Miller) behind a slab of glass. Bi disbelief. Woodward behind them, doing his job. Audrey's mouth is moving. But we can't hear what with. Sh trying to get Felt’s attention. Joan trying to calm her. we make out - muffled through glass - what she’s yelling:

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Tell them who you are! Tell them what you did! Felt turns straight at the camera, defiant.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tell! Them! Who! You! Are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felt emerges first with Audrey and Joan, Millers next, th Gray and his wife. Long walk down a dark corridor. To meet 300 FBI AGENTS spilling into the street. There is no noise. This is eerie. Then they begin to CLAP unison, a long string of unending claps. As Felt steps in and through the crowd, across this tableau:

dialogues.speaker: END CRAWL
dialogues.text: * Mark Felt was convicted of conspiracy for ordering unconstitutional break-ins against the Weather Undergroun fined, and sentenced to 10 years in prison. * Newly elected Ronald Reagan pardoned Felt in his first as President of the United States. * Shortly after, Audrey Felt shot herself in the head wit Felt’s FBI-issue revolver. * In 2005, at the age of 92, Felt finally revealed he was Washington Post source on Watergate known as “Deep Throat * Felt spent his last years living with his daughter, Joa and her children. He died December 18, 2008.
